msItem.note: Edition's Side A is Recto; Side B Verso according to APIS guidelines.

condition.ab: Light brown papyrus. The original cutting edges are preserved on the top, left and bottom sides. The right side is broken off with a loss of two to three words at the beginning of all lines. On the left upper corner a hole caused by the disappearance of some papyrus fibers has resulted in the loss of one or two words in one line.

handDesc.p: Written in black ink with a thin pen perpendicular to the fibers on the recto, parallel to the fibers on Verso. The ink is chipped off or faded in some places and has caused one complete line to be completely unreadable. There are no diacritical dots.
